Class HitsFromQuery

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Hit>, SearchResult

    public class HitsFromQuery
extends Hits
    A Hits object that is filled from a BLSpanQuery.

      • HitsFromQuery

                        BLSpanQuery sourceQuery,
                        SearchSettings searchSettings)
                 throws WildcardTermTooBroad
        Construct a Hits object from a SpanQuery.
        Parameters:
        queryInfo - query info
        sourceQuery - the query to execute to get the hits
        searchSettings - search settings
        Throws:
        WildcardTermTooBroad - if the query is overly broad (expands to too many terms)

    • Method Detail

      • toString

      • ensureResultsRead

        protected void ensureResultsRead(int number)
        Ensure that we have read at least as many hits as specified in the parameter.
        Specified by:
        ensureResultsRead in class Results<Hit>
        Parameters:
        number - the minimum number of hits that will have been read when this method returns (unless there are fewer hits than this); if negative, reads all hits

      • doneProcessingAndCounting

        public boolean doneProcessingAndCounting()
        Description copied from class: Results
        Check if we're done retrieving/counting hits. If you're retrieving hits in a background thread, call this method from another thread to check if all hits have been processed.
        Specified by:
        doneProcessingAndCounting in class Results<Hit>
        Returns:
        true iff all hits have been retrieved/counted.

      • maxStats

        public MaxStats maxStats()
        Description copied from class: Hits
        Did we exceed the maximum number of hits to process/count? NOTE: this is only valid for the original Hits instance (that executes the query), and not for any derived Hits instance (window, sorted, filtered, ...). The reason that this is not part of QueryInfo is that this creates a brittle link between derived Hits instances and the original Hits instances, which by now may have been aborted, leaving the max stats in a frozen, incorrect state.
        Specified by:
        maxStats in class Hits
        Returns:
        our max stats, or MaxStats.NOT_EXCEEDED if not available for this instance
